source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
evidence_span: The reference material used in this work is standard Zircaloy-4 $( \mathbf { Z } \mathbf { y } 4 \ \mathbf { S } \mathbf { T } \mathbf { D } )$ furnished by Cézus of Ugine, France.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
evidence_span: Samples were machined out of a $\mathbf { 1 - m m }$ -thick plate (Zr-1.48Sn-0.21Fe$\mathbf { 0 . 1 1 C r - 0 . 1 0 0 } )$ and fully recrystallized at $9 4 8 ~ \mathrm { K }$ for $^ { 3 \mathrm { ~ h ~ } }$ and $3 0 \ \mathrm { m i n }$ after cold rolling $\mathbf { \vec { \lambda } } \mathbf { A } i =$ $4 \cdot 1 0 ^ { - 1 9 }$ h using $Q / R = 4 0 0 0 0 ~ \mathrm { K } )$ .

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
evidence_span: To increase precipitate size and thereby facilitate their observation, some specimens of the standard Zircaloy-4 were subjected to an additional coarsening heat treatment at $1 0 5 5 \mathrm { ~ K ~ }$ for ${ \mathfrak { s o } } \mathbf { h }$ This material with large precipitates is referred to as Zy4 HT.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
evidence_span: Some samples (20 by $3 0 \mathrm { \ m m } \mathrm { \dot { \Omega } }$ )have been irradiated on both faces with $1 . 5 \ : \mathrm { M e V } \ : \mathrm { H e ^ { + } }$ ion irradiations in the Van de Graaff ion accelerator of the Centre d'Etudes Nucléaires de Grenoble, at ${ 7 7 ~ \bf K }$ and to a dose of 0.4 displacements per atom (dpa), to simulate neutron irradiation and produce, at the surface, amorphous precipitates.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
evidence_span: Reference and irradiated recrystallized Zircaloy-4 cladding materials have also been used in this work. The chemical compositions of these materials are Zr-1.75Sn-0.23Fe-0.10Cr0.110 and $\mathrm { Z r 1 . 7 1 S n . 0 . 2 1 F e . 0 . 1 2 C r . 0 . 1 5 O . }$ respectively.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
evidence_span: Reference and irradiated recrystallized Zircaloy-4 cladding materials have also been used in this work. The chemical compositions of these materials are Zr-1.75Sn-0.23Fe-0.10Cr0.110 and $\mathrm { Z r 1 . 7 1 S n . 0 . 2 1 F e . 0 . 1 2 C r . 0 . 1 5 O . }$ respectively.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
evidence_span: The irradiated cladding samples (25- mm-long tubes) were exposed to two and three irradiation cycles in the experimental BR3 reactor at about $\bf { 5 9 0 ~ K }$ to fluences of 4.0 and $5 . 4 1 0 ^ { 2 5 } \ n \cdot \mathbf { m } ^ { - 2 }$ , respectively.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
evidence_span: The irradiated cladding samples (25- mm-long tubes) were exposed to two and three irradiation cycles in the experimental BR3 reactor at about $\bf { 5 9 0 ~ K }$ to fluences of 4.0 and $5 . 4 1 0 ^ { 2 5 } \ n \cdot \mathbf { m } ^ { - 2 }$ , respectively.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk1
evidence_span: The oxide thickness produced during three cycles has been estimated, when preparing thin foils, to be of the order of $1 0 ~ { \mu \mathrm { m } }$ .

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk6
evidence_span: The major material effect is the size and distribution of precipitates. For optimizing both early and late corrosion, the size has to stay in a small range.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk6
evidence_span: In the case of material quenched in the final stage, the quenching rate appears to be an important parameter.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk6
evidence_span: the in-BWR results indicate that corrosion in BWRs is influenced by the alloying elements tin, chromium, and the impurity silicon.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_039_chunk6
evidence_span: A large variation from lot to lot under identical coolant condition has been found.

evidence_span: The available data indicate that the chromium content is the most important material parameter for hydrogen pickup.
